Dwarves on Parade

Physical/Mental Characteristics: Your average Dwarf is a comparativly short being,averaging about 4 ft. tall. While shorter than you humans, we are much stronger and somewhat faster and more dextrous. Dwarves tend not to be well-liked by other races, who say that we are stubborn and hard-headed. It's just that we see no reason to ignore hundreds of years of time-tested wisdom in some brash act. This doesn't mean that we're lazy or listless by any means. Our strength and strong consitutions suit us to the life of the Warrior, Cleric, Paladin, or Rogue. While Dwarven Rogues do not suffer the persecution normal to the profession in our city, they are also expected never to prey on other dwarves. Dwarves of all types have a healthy fear of true, non-clerical magic. The arcane is beyond our knowledge and we have no desire to blow ourselves up trying to learn about it! Our skill lies in the more physical realm. Dwarven metalsmiths, jewelers, and stonemasons are considered to be the finest in their professions. It is said that a Dwarf-forged blade will keep it's edge for the lifetime of the owner, and his children! Dwarves also fear the sea. We prefer the world to be as unchanging as the rock that surrounds our home, and the sea is a perfect symbol of rampant, destructive change. In perhaps what is an unusual paradox, the Dwarves built Port Faydwer, to the west of Kaladim, where the Butcherblocks meet the sea.

Relations to other Races: Dwarves are allies of the Wood Elves and High Elves, as well as our cousins, the Gnomes. Our sworn enemies are the Runny Eye Goblins, the Crushbone Orcs, and the Ogres of Oggok, two of which have been rampaging about the Butcherblocks recently. We are neutral towards Humans and Barbarians, but despise Dark Elves and Trolls almost as much as we do Ogres. We sometimes find Halflings annoying, as they tend to pilfer our fine metalworks.

Factions: This shows the names and compositions of the various factions in Kaladim. The "improving faction" note shows the relative difficulty of improving you faction with the given group. This takes into account faction giving enemies in the area, as well as at what fac levels certain quests are given.

Stormguard: Consists of the Warriors and Guards. Improving faction: Easy
Clerics of Underfoot: The Clerics and Paladins. Improving Faction: Moderate
Miner's Guild 628: The Rogue's Guild. Improving Faction: Moderate
Kaladim Citizens: Dwarves as a whole. Improving Faction: Very Difficult
Kaladim Merchants: Dwarven Merchants. Improving Faction: Varies by guild
King Kazon Stormhammer:Your rating with the King. Improving Faction: Easy
